action.action-desc: Mr. Hastings introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit assistance to the Palestinian Authority until it withdraws its request to join the International Criminal Court.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defend Israel by Defunding Palestinian Foreign Aid Act of 2015.

paragraph.text: On December 31, 2014, Mahmoud Abbas, the President of the Palestinian Authority, signed several international conventions in an attempt to join the International Criminal Court.
The Palestinian Authority has indicated that it will seek to use the International Criminal Court as a means to pursue charges against Israel.

The Palestinian Authority remains engaged in a unity government with Hamas, a terrorist organization responsible for countless deaths and whose charter declares that there is no solution to the Palestinian question except by Jihad.
The United States provides more than $400,000,000 in assistance to the Palestinian Authority each year.

Section 7041(i)(2) of the Department of State, Foreign Operations, and Related Programs Appropriations Act, 2015 (division J of Public Law 133â€“235) includes limitations on assistance to the Palestinian Authority if it seeks to join the International Criminal Court.
The United States Government must make immediately clear to the Palestinian Authority that its attempts to join the International Criminal Court will carry serious consequences.

section.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no amounts may be obligated or expended to provide any assistance, loan guarantee, or debt relief to the Palestinian Authority, or any affiliated governing entity, until the Palestinian Authority withdraws its request to join the International Criminal Court.
